datafield.subfield: On the Apparent Non-coaxiality of the Tangential Interaction

The contact interactions between real particles are extremely complex, and unknown, due to particle shape and surface roughness. In DEM simulations, even for spherical particles, the tangential interaction is complicated. This is due to the fact that, after the old tangential displacement has been rotated to account for the rotation of the contact normal vector, the new relative tangential displacement increment is not coaxial with the adjusted old tangential displacement. The paper offers a ‘new’ solution to this problem and discusses the consequent implications.
Birmingham U. - Edgbaston - Birmingham - B15 2TT - UK
